controller

Class MovieController

  • java.lang.Object
    • controller.DatabaseController
      • controller.MovieController

  • public class MovieController
extends DatabaseController
    A controller to perform storing and retrieval of Movie to/from database. Also validates changes before committing any changes to database.
    Since:
    2017-11-06
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Meiru

    • Method Detail

      • addMovie

        public void addMovie(int movieId,
                     java.lang.String movieName,
                     java.lang.String synopsis,
                     java.lang.String director,
                     java.lang.String cast,
                     MovieShowingStatus status,
                     int duration)
        Add Movie into the database after staff has key in all the details required by the StaffUI.
        Parameters:
        movieId - MovieID of the movie.
        movieName - Name of the movie.
        synopsis - Synopsis of the movie.
        director - Director of the movie.
        cast - Cast of the movie.
        status - Showing Status of the movie.
        duration - Duration of the movie.

      • readDB

        protected void readDB()
        Retrieve the movies from database. The order is as follows: MovieID, Movie Name, Showing Status, Synopsis, Directory, Cast, Overall rating, Bookable, Ticket Sales, Duration, End Date of Showing, Reviews, Ratings. These variables are parsed into the Movie objects and stored when the Movie Controller is initalized.
        Specified by:
        readDB in class DatabaseController

      • removeMovie

        public Movie removeMovie(int movieId)
        Removes the movie based on its unique MovieID. It will validate if the movie exists in the database.
        Parameters:
        movieId - MovieID of the movie to remove.
        Returns:
        Removed Movie object if it exists. null object if movie is not found.

      • updateMovie

        public void updateMovie(int movieId,
                        java.lang.String newMovieName,
                        java.lang.String newSynopsis,
                        java.lang.String newdirector,
                        java.lang.String newCast,
                        MovieShowingStatus newStatus,
                        int duration)
        Modify an existing movie in the database. It will validate if the movie exists before committing the change.
        Parameters:
        movieId - MovieID of the movie to change.
        newMovieName - New Movie Name of the movie.
        newSynopsis - New Synopsis of the movie.
        newdirector - New Director name of the movie.
        newCast - New cast of the movie.
        newStatus - New Showing status of the movie.
        duration - Duration of the movie.

      • updateMovieEndOfShowing

        public void updateMovieEndOfShowing(int movieID,
                                    java.util.Calendar showingEndDate)
        Update a movie for its end of showing date.
        Parameters:
        movieID - Movie ID of the movie.
        showingEndDate - End date of the movie.

      • updateMovieSales

        public void updateMovieSales(int movieID,
                             double sales)
        Update a movie sales.
        Parameters:
        movieID - MovieID of the movie.
        sales - Sales to add to a movie.

      • writeDB

        protected void writeDB()
        Save the Movie model into database. Each line in the Movie.dat file is a booking object. The order is as follows: MovieID, Movie Name, Showing Status, Synopsis, Directory, Cast, Overall rating, Bookable, Ticket Sales, Duration, End Date of Showing, Reviews, Ratings. These will be appended into the Movie.dat file in sequence.
        Specified by:
        writeDB in class DatabaseController
